Absolutely.  It is particularly important since the array of values is dete=
rmined programatically.  As I add new instances of entities that have to be=
 tested, that will affect the order of the data points.

Additionally, what=
 may be just as useful, or even more useful is for the Theories test runner=
 to decorate the assertion failure message.  For example: the parameter val=
ues would be prepended to the failure message (even when the message has no=
 value).
